revised_title: Drying Patterns in Suspensions: A Study of Structures Formed in Drying Fluids with Particles
tldr: The authors studied the structures formed when a fluid with particles in suspension dries. They observed various patterns, such as winding networks, straight axes, and fan-shaped tufts, depending on the nature of the material, the density of the fluid, and the drying conditions. These findings can help understand geological structures and provide insights into the drying process.
